Class FlyingEnemy

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
city.cs.engine.Walker
game.entities.Enemy
game.entities.FlyingEnemy
public class FlyingEnemy extends Enemy
Represents a flying enemy that extends the behavior of a regular enemy by adding vertical movement.

  • Field Details

    • flyingTimer

      private Timer flyingTimer
      A separate Timer for vertical (flying) movement. We store it here so we can stop/resume it independently.

    • isDestroyed

      private boolean isDestroyed
      Indicates whether this entity has already been destroyed.

      Once destroy() is called, this flag is set to true, allowing game logic to check destruction state without relying solely on the physics engineâ€™s body removal.

  • Constructor Details

    • FlyingEnemy

      public FlyingEnemy(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position)
      Constructs a FlyingEnemy with a specified position in the game world.

      This constructor calls the superclass constructor with a speed of 0 to disable horizontal movement, removes the default enemy images, adds a custom .gif image, and starts the flying-specific vertical movement.

      Parameters:
      world - The game world the flying enemy exists in.
      position - The starting position of the flying enemy.

  • Method Details

    • updateAnimation

      public void updateAnimation()
      Overrides updateAnimation to prevent the timer in the superclass from changing the .gif image.

      This method is intentionally left empty to maintain the custom flying enemy image.

      Overrides:
      updateAnimation in class Enemy

    • startFlyingMovement

      private void startFlyingMovement()
      Starts the vertical oscillation movement of the flying enemy.

      A timer is used to alternate the vertical velocity between moving up and moving down.

    • stopMovement

      public void stopMovement()
      Stops both the superclass movement timer (if any) and this flyingTimer, so the flying enemy no longer moves horizontally or vertically.
      Overrides:
      stopMovement in class Enemy

    • resumeMovement

      public void resumeMovement()
      Resumes both the superclass movement timer (if any) and this flyingTimer, so the flying enemy continues moving horizontally and vertically.
      Overrides:
      resumeMovement in class Enemy

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Marks this entity as destroyed and invokes the superclass destruction logic.

      Setting isDestroyed before calling super.destroy() ensures that any subsequent checks to isDestroyed() will accurately reflect that this object has been removed.

      Overrides:
      destroy in class Enemy

    • isDestroyed

      public boolean isDestroyed()
      Checks whether this entity has been destroyed.
      Overrides:
      isDestroyed in class Enemy
      Returns:
      true if destroy() has been called on this object; false otherwise.
